data.text:
You will hardly find anyone who remembers Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas is the love child of Dorothy Jean Dandridge and Harold Nicholas. Her parents were African-American artists who excelled in their respective fields and etched their names permanently in the ink of history for the accomplishments they achieved and the ceilings they crossed to challenge their claims and their talents in the entertainment industry.

His mother Dorothy, was a renowned singer, dancer, theater and film actress, one of the most famous of her time. She not only had a thriving career in Hollywood at a time when racism and segregation were still at its height, but she became the first black woman in history to be nominated for the Academy Award for Best Actress for her dazzling performance in Carmen Jones (1954).

His father, Harold was also a game changer. Considered one of the best dancers of all time, he belonged to one of the most famous two-man dance duos in the world, alongside his brother Fayard. The brothers were bona fide celebrities best known for their electrifying tap-dancing abilities. They pretty much paved the way for other artists of color such as Dellie Allen and Moonwalking superstar Michael Jackson. Harold and his brother have performed in many high profile shows, movies, musicals and other events.

Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas – Biography,

Harolyn was born on September 2, 1943 in Los Angeles.Angeles, California to famed actress Dorothy Dandridge and superstar dancer Harold Nicholas. Nicholas had the misfortune to be born brain damaged. She suffered from a condition called cerebral anoxia which affected her cognitive abilities and other functions. Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas couldn’t speak until she was four years old and she wasn’t able to communicate or recognize people, not even her parents.

His mother blamed herself for Harolyn’s condition because she delayed the delivery to allow Harold to get to the hospital in time for the delivery, but Harolyn’s illness was later proven to be a result of the surgical instruments. used for birth that cut off the oxygen supply. to part of his brain.

Despite her illness, Harolyn was still trying to find some joy in life. She was a happy and fun child. Her mother tried to do everything in her power to improve her daughter and give her a more comfortable life. She spent thousands of dollars on doctors and specialists, but all her efforts were in vain. The challenge of raising a child like Harolyn complicated her parents’ marriage. His father was barely present during his formative years and he eventually abandoned his family and divorced Dorothy.

Eventually, Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas had to be admitted to a private care facility because caring for her became too difficult and took too much time away from her career and other activities. At this time, it is unknown whether Harolyn is alive or dead. However, if she is still alive, she would be in her 70s. No one has provided concrete or conclusive information about the child of this iconic African-American performer.

Facts About Harold Nicholas’ Daughter

His family

Dorothy Dandridge and Harold Nicholas, of Harolyn’s parents met in 1938 in Harlem, when they were both hanging out at the Cotton Club. The couple married on September 6, 1942, and soon after welcomed their first and only child, Harolyn, together. However, their marriage only lasted nine years before Harold completely abandoned his responsibilities to his family and divorced his actress wife.

Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas, the iconic mother actress was found naked and dead in her apartment by her manager on September 8, 1965. Autopsy reports later revealed that Dorothy died of an accidental drug overdose, while another revealed the death of a large embolism. Her father, Harold, died decades later of heart failure on July 3, 2000.

What is his net worth?

Harolyn Suzanne Nicholas comes from a long line of successful and talented people. Her ancestors have a strong heritage, rooted in show business, although she was unable to pursue a career due to her disability. Therefore, there is no information about Harolyn’s net worth, but it is probably on the lower end of the scale.

Fast facts to know

1. Her dad was a dope dad for most of his life and he wasn’t interested in her life or taking care of her.

2. Harolyn Nicholas had to become a ward of the state of California after her mother went bankrupt and could no longer care for her, so she gave up all parental rights.
